wikipedia_page.main: William Gordon (24 September 1831 – 7 June 1911) was an English prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He was the second Bishop of Leeds.

* 7 June – William Gordon, Roman Catholic bishop (born 1831)

William Gordon Wheeler was an English prelate and the bishop emeritus of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Leeds. Wheeler had served as the seventh Roman Catholic Bishop of Leeds, being succeeded by David Konstant. Before that, he served as coadjutor bishop of the Diocese of Middlesbrough and as Titular Bishop of Theudalis."Bishop Wheeler to retire", The Times, 24 August 1985 p. 10.

Roche's first appointment in the diocese was as assistant priest at Holy Rood Church in Barnsley until 1978, when he became private secretary to Bishop William Gordon Wheeler. He was appointed Vice-Chancellor of the diocese in 1979. From 1982 to 1989, he served on the staff of St Anne's Cathedral in Leeds, and helped to organise the visit of Pope John Paul II to York in May 1982.
Cowgill became the third Bishop of Leeds, when he succeeded William Gordon who died in office on 7 June 1911.

link_mentions.page: Our Lady of Lourdes Church, Leeds
response: In 1905, William Gordon, Roman Catholic Bishop of Leeds, invited the Jesuits to take over the running of it. Shortly afterwards, the presbytery was moved to Vinery RoadPortrait of Father Gitts, of Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church from Leodis.net. Retrieved 11 March 2014 and the Jesuits built a church on the site of the old cottage, which became the parish church of the local area, Sacred Heart Church.Burley Road nos. 221/223 from Leodis.net. Retrieved 11 March 2014
